name: The Game Where You Break Pencils
name_original: The Game Where You Break Pencils
description:
When I was a young boy, still in elementary. My teacher brought me up to the front of the room.

He asked me "What do you know about teamwork?"

At the time I did not know what he was talking about so I just Stated "I'm sorry sir but I do not know."

He then took a pencil, held it out and snapped it in half in front of me. He asked me again, "What do you know about teamwork?"

I still had no idea what he was saying so I replied "I'm sorry but I do not understand."

He then took 2 pencils, and with a little more effort snapped them in half right in my face and asked me for a 3rd time "What do you know about teamwork?"

I just stood there dazed and confused. I did not know what to think.

Then without me saying a word he snapped 3 pencils and the same time in front me and asked again a bit louder "What do you know about teamwork?!"

This went on for a while, until he finally got to 12 pencils, but no matter how much he struggled he could not break 12.

And that is when I knew what he meant.

That day changed me forever and I still think about it everyday.

Seriously though this game took me forever. It is the most effort I ever put into a game and it isn't even that good, but I had fun making it so I hope you have fun playing/experiencing it.

I love constructive criticism so please leave some in the comments if you have any.
